author: Staff Reporter
text:
The family of Saverianandham (51), employed in a parcel service company in Malaysia, came to the Collectorate here on Saturday seeking the intervention of the district administration to help him return home safe.

The family is residing at Kadankulam village in Nanguneri taluk. Sahayamary, wife of Saverianandham, in a petition submitted to the Collector, M. Karunakaran, said they did not know whether Saverianandham was alive.

Lastly, when he spoke to his wife, he said he would return on February 26 owing to poor health.

But, a person identifying himself as Eswaran called Sahayamary over phone from Malaysia on the same day at 8.20 p.m. and said Saverianandham died of ill health at the airport.

He claimed himself to be the proprietor of the company, which employed Saverianandham.

The caller demanded Rs.1.5 lakh, which he said should be transacted through a private agency on February 27 to send Saverianandham’s body from Malaysia, the petitioner said.
title: Wife seeks help to ensure safe return of husband from Malaysia
